definition: lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Retain the most memorable kiss, kissing the man failed to keep.
sentences.chinese: 留住了最刻骨铭心的吻，留不住接吻的那个人。

sentences.english: As a child he remembers two things.
sentences.chinese: 关于童年，有两件事让他刻骨铭心。

sentences.english: Very deep personal feelings constitute the main body of these nove…
sentences.chinese: 在这些小说里刻骨铭心的个人感受构成了生活的主体。

sentences.english: Since then, this paragraph of deep-rooted love only by more people know.
sentences.chinese: 自此，这段刻骨铭心的爱恋才被更多的人知道。

sentences.english: Chunling finally wrote to express a long-standing water mountain unforgettable nostalgic.
sentences.chinese: 春玲终于写信向水山表达了长久以来刻骨铭心的眷恋。

sentences.english: It also has something profound. That is the sanguinary nature of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 里面还有一种刻骨铭心的东西，就是人类的嗜血本性。

sentences.english: Since that unforgettable memory, in fact, as early as others to forget.
sentences.chinese: 自以为刻骨铭心的记忆，其实别人早以忘记。

sentences.english: They were unable to erase the deep fear of scarcity both had acquired in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩谁都无法消除小时侯对贫穷的刻骨铭心的恐惧。

sentences.english: The door-to-door guys learned that the hard way.
sentences.chinese: 挨家挨户敲门的推销员刻骨铭心地学到了这点。

sentences.english: This kind of inspirational guidance indeed made impressions deep into one's mind as if carved onto bones.
sentences.chinese: 这种冥冥中的指引，著实令人刻骨铭心。

sentences.english: Per Duan Xingfu front, imprint is engraved on my heart. To experience pain.
sentences.chinese: 每段幸福前面，总要经历刻骨铭心旳痛。

sentences.english: The first phase The imprint is engraved on my heart. moment Xu, who sound reminders of rain.
sentences.chinese: 那一次刻骨铭心的相许，那一刻为谁声声催天雨。

sentences.english: Once you take friendship seriously, it's gonna be more unforgettable than love.
sentences.chinese: 友情这东西，一旦玩真的，比爱情还刻骨铭心。

sentences.english: Yet the Great Leap Forward was a monumental failure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大跃进的一场令人刻骨铭心的失败。

sentences.english: Self-righteousness, deep-rooted memories, others already have forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 自以为是刻骨铭心的回忆，别人早已已经忘记了。

sentences.english: The overwhelming sense of not being loved.
sentences.chinese: 那是一种不被爱的刻骨铭心的感觉。

definition: engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
separated in life and death/to part for ever
